name: The Global Uplift Project (formerly known as ODFL)
keywords: Helping Others, Awareness, Outreach, Teamwork, Community
description: TGUP is a service club on campus that aims to create a change in third world countries by collecting just $1 from high school students.
activities: Club members will be involved in various fundraising events, planning of new projects in third world countries, and have the opportunity to go on a service trip abroad!
interesting: TGUP has completed over 120 successful and high impact projects in the developing world since its founding. These include classrooms, medical clinics, water systems, science labs, playgrounds and other projects that improve life chances for some of the poorest people in the world.

name: Best Buddies
keywords: Helping Others, Health/Disabilities, Awareness, Outreach, Community
description: To facilitate friendships between LAHS students and people with intellectual or developmental disabilities.
activities: Last year we had friendship bracelet making, Halloween bingo, a huge thanksgiving potluck, cookie decorating, pumpkin decorating contest, and much more! We had many more fun ideas for meeting such as bullet journal making, board game days, and watching movies/clips about those with disabilities.
interesting: Feeling included helps someone feel safe and welcome. We want to make sure that everyone feels welcomed and know that they have friends nearby. You should Best Buddies to help spread this inclusion throughout the entirety of the school.

name: Women in STEM
keywords: STEM, Diversity, Education, Community, Helping Others
description: To promote equal representation in STEM by encouraging and supporting a growing community of women in STEM
activities: WiSTEM
interesting: WiSTEM offers an abundance of opportunities for any student. We also offer a safe community for people's voices to be heard and are accepting of all students. We have a variety of ways to engage members, so there will never be a dull moment!

name: Biomimicry Club
keywords: STEM, Competition, Education, Design, Community
description: To explore the work of nature and combat global issues through creative designs with interdisciplinary insights into biology and engineering.
activities: The Biomimicry Club provides an open environment for students to exercise research skills, practice prototype designs, and ultimately compete in the Biomimicry Youth Design Challenge. Prototype design “drills” and guest speakers events are organized to provide students with design-thinking mindsets while broadening their understanding of engineering.
interesting: Students interested in either engineering or biology bring different perspectives to the collaborate discussions and generate creative biomimicry ideas; everyone is welcomed!

name: Photography Club
keywords: Art, Design, Creative, Community, Leisure
description: Dedicated to teaching fellow students photography free of academic obligations. No background in photography needed!
activities: Taking pictures, whether they are using their phone or a camera. Also learning about what makes up the composition of a photo and improving photography skills.
interesting: Photography can be a creative outlet with little to no regulations. There is no "correct" way to take a photo and in Photo Club you would be given the chance to practice and hone your skills.

name: Guitar Club
keywords: Music, Art, Creative, Community, Leisure
description: We'll learn and play guitar together (as best we can remotely), and we'll collaborate and create songs. This is a place for anybody that just wants to have fun and jam with other people; bassists, keyboardists, drummers, etc. are all welcome too.
activities: Recording their parts in songs, editing videos, creating tutorials, choosing songs to play, writing music
interesting: A lot of people play instruments like the guitar, bass, or drums but it's hard to find other people to play with — it's not like there's a school-sponsored "rock music program" like there are orchestras or wind ensembles. This is just kind of a place to meet other people that like to play similar music.

name: Russian Club
keywords: Cultural, Community, Education, Helping Others, Leisure
description: A place for those interested in the immensely diverse and sophisticated culture of Russia.
activities:
Distance-Learning: Learn about Russian culture, explore the Russian language, and connect with others.
In-person: Enjoy authentic Russian food, participate in group events, go on field trips, watch movies, and much more!
interesting: Increase your awareness about Russian culture, history, and language in a fun and informal setting.

name: Buena Vista Youth Scholars (BVYS)
keywords: Education, Helping Others, Outreach, Awareness, Teamwork
description: Buena Vista Youth Scholars is a program that  provides tutors, role models, and mentors to the children in the Buena Vista Mobile Home Park in Palo Alto.
activities: During their time, club members can volunteer to tutor children at Buena Vista in their homework and other concepts learned in school. Most of the children are in grades K-5, although we sometimes have middle schoolers and high schoolers. Tutoring is on a voluntary basis, and volunteers can sign up for certain days and times.
interesting: BVYS gives you the unique opportunity to connect with people in your community who you may otherwise never meet. You will make new friends, learn new things about yourself and others, and become part of an amazing organization and community.

name: Mock Trial
keywords: Public Speaking, Competition, Leadership, Creative, Community
description: The Mock Trial team competes in a simulated courtroom environment coached by real lawyers and presided over by county judges. Each year, we receive a new case from the county and prepare arguments for the prosecution and the defense, with different roles like attorneys, witnesses, clerks, bailiffs, etc.
activities: We have weekly meeting to prepare arguments for cases and practice our roles. Then in January, we compete in the county Mock Trial competition with other teams from around the area.
interesting: Mock Trial helps to build public speaking skills, practice acting, learn how a real courtroom works, and develop a fun community (and we have cool hoodies).

name: Data Analysis Club
keywords: Leadership, Coding, Creative, STEM, Helping Others
description: The Data Analysis Club is committed to making the school a better place through the power of Math, CS and critical thinking. We tutor, give lectures, and run year-long projects for LAHS students!
activities:
Every meeting, we'll give engaging lectures for 10-15 minutes on how to apply data to cutting edge science such as economics, the brain, and computing.

Then, we'll split off into teams and giving personal help to people excited about making data-related projects.
interesting: This club is great for beginners and advanced programmers of all backgrounds -- we give tools and past experiences that can help anyone create a cool project that you'll be proud of.

name: Competitive Investment Club (CIC)
keywords: Competition, STEM, Leisure, Teamwork, Food
description: The Competitive Investment Club (CIC), promotes learning about investing and trading equity through competition. Students learn about the economy by participating in a stock market simulation and compete to learn and make the most profit.
activities: Learning about stocks, expanding their portfolios, highlighting potential investment opportunities, talking with each other, and getting the experience of the real stock market.
interesting: People should join because they get an experience identical to the real stock market, can win real prizes, and have fun through competition.

name: National Art Honors Society (NAHS)
keywords: Art, Helping Others, Community, Outreach, Teamwork
description: We'll have meetings every Friday during lunch and expect members to volunteer through activities like the art auction, participation in refugee portrait project and the color run.
activities: You'll get to make art to sell at the school wide art auction, paint musical sets, create and send portraits of children refugees, face-paint in the color run and many more!
interesting: You get volunteering hours from doing something you love to do & can make positive impact in the community! You'll also get to meet new friends that shares passion for art and feel a sense of belonging in the art community!

name: The Passion Project
keywords: Helping Others, Education, Leadership, Community, Outreach
description: The function of The Passion Project club is to provide free activities to students from grades K-8. High schoolers who volunteer will be able to document service hours for teaching others what they love doing.
activities: Club members will get the opportunity to earn volunteer hours by teaching classes (online for now) to younger students. During club meetings, members will develop their lesson plans, and be a part of a section that focuses specifically on either outreach, planning the annual summer camp, or coordinating weekly activities and tutoring programs.
interesting: This club provides a unique opportunity for high schoolers to share their passions with children from all over the globe. High schoolers will be able to earn volunteer hours while being able to hone their leadership skills. The Passion Project’s classes are a highlight of the day for many children, so teaching can be a really rewarding experience because you can bring a smile to someone’s face during these turbulent times.

name: Quiz Bowl Club
keywords: Competition, Teamwork, Creative, Education, Leisure
description: Promote quiz bowl participation and practice for tournaments.
activities: Practice trivia questions and go to online tournaments
interesting: If you're interested in trivia and enjoy competition, quiz bowl is a fun way to demonstrate your intelligence.

name: InspireAI
keywords: Coding, STEM, Education, Design, Community
description: To teach students how to code with AI and deep learning in order to develop interesting and unique projects
activities: Club members will learn the basics of machine and deep learning and spend meetings creating fun projects to apply these skills.
interesting: AI is very rarely taught in high school but is really important in the real world, so by joining they can get early exposure to this really interesting field!

name: Learning ASL Club
keywords: Health/Disabilities, Community, Awareness, Outreach, Helping Others
description: ASL club is open to anyone who wants to learn how to sign (which is especially useful in times like these with everyone using masks). We we learn ASL together through watching videos and other activities.
activities: The club members will be taught how to sign. Starting with the basics, members will progress to learn how to sign about any other topics they want. Members will be taught live by some officers, and they will also be taught through professional videos. Once members are good enough, we will have conversations signing and have games that involve only signing.
interesting: Join ASL if you've always wanted to learn how to sign, or communicate with other people without using words! Now would especially be a good time learning sign for the deaf community since everybody is wearing masks and the deaf can't read lips now. ASL club will have fun ways of learning signing and anything you want to learn in sign language!

name: Aerospace Club
keywords: Design, STEM, Community, Creative, Education
description: The Aerospace Club is for people who are interested in aerospace and would like to learn about it and/or teach others about it.
activities: Working on building or talking about various aerospace topics
interesting:
- Very relaxed, includes enough time to eat lunch
- Things that fly are cool

name: CodeSV
keywords: STEM, Coding, Education, Design, Creative
description: Our club plans to organize our free summer coding camps and recruit other students to help teach at these camps.
activities:
- Help organize the camps by giving input on what classes should be taught
- Learn what they need to know to be successful teachers during the summer camps
interesting: - Help students learn to code, gain volunteer experience, and develop your own coding skill through teaching!

name: Interact Club
keywords: Community, Leadership, Helping Others, Outreach, Awareness
description: To empower high schoolers to lead effectively through various community service opportunities, while fundraising for district wide projects
activities: During our meetings, we will be doing fun service projects and bonding with club members.
interesting: You get to volunteer with your friends and meet people from all over the bay area at district wide events.

name: Math Club
keywords: STEM, Education, Competition, Teamwork, Community
description: To help students foster interest in math outside the classroom through lectures, discussions and competitions.
activities:
- Learn and discuss math!
- Solve interesting problems
interesting:
- Topics are often not taught in classrooms, lectures are accessible to all levels of mathematical experience
- Math is inherently beautiful
- Competitions are fun and rewarding
- Developing problem solving skills is immensely useful

name: Chess Club
keywords: Sports, Teamwork, Community, Leisure, Creative
description: We want everyone to join chess club to hang out with some friends and play some games. Whether its Bug house (4 people) or Bullet (30 second games), we want everyone to have fun with it and be creative.
activities: Club members would try to organize online events as much as possible. We would like a safe return for everyone and there is not rush in terms of meeting in a room when we can have a safe learning environment at home. We have also tested online chess club via a discord server for 2 years and it has worked perfectly. For now, we want to gather people to the club and get as many people as possible.
interesting: People should join as chess is a game of skill in creative thinking as well as forethought. It is really impressive and is very fun! At the end of the day, it's a game.

name: Fellowship of Christian Athletes
keywords: Sports, Leisure, Cultural, Helping Others, Community
description: To present to athletes and coaches , and all whom they influence, the challenge and adventure of receiving Jesus Christ as Savior and Lord, serving Him in their relationships and in the fellowship of the church.
activities: They will be partaking in meetings in which we discuss topics and do devotionals to see how certain biblical ideals can connect to athletics. There are also some outreaches, though, due to COVID, is not likely, that host sports events and personal anecdotes to help reach out to the general public.
interesting: It is a unique take on christianity, and the system of FCA goes international and is a great place for others to meet new people and to be introduced to christianity, and how it meshes in with athletics.

name: Culinary Club
keywords: Food, Community, Creative, Education, Leisure
description: To provide an environment in which brand-new and seasoned chefs alike can have fun in the kitchen.
activities:
Cook and bake together
Learn about cooking fundamentals
Eat the delicious food we make
interesting: If you like food, you should join. Simple as that.

name: Environmental Club (Green Team)
keywords: Awareness, STEM, Outreach, Teamwork, Community
description: To foster a culture of environmental responsibility and sustainability at Los Altos High School and the local community through organizing both large scale and local events.
activities:
• Pursuing projects with local organizations, campus administration, other GT members
• Planning our Bay-Area wide annual Students for Green High School conference
• Improving our campus and community for the better!
interesting:
• You can make a tangible change! In past years we’ve helped reduce on-campus idling by 80%, encourage sustainable transportation by influencing parking permit policy, and unite over 28 Bay-Area environmental organizations in a day of idea-exchange and inspiration.
• Join our community and make new friends!
• Our world needs saving! And YOU can do something about it.

name: Students for Haiti Solidarity
keywords: Outreach, Education, Awareness, Community, Leadership
description: Students for Haiti Solidarity works closely with closely with people on the ground in Haiti to provide support for SOPUDEP, our sister school in Haiti, as well as working to fundraise money for the school.
activities: During meetings, we will be planning and organizing fundraising events as well as any protests/demonstrations that we want to participate in. We also discuss any events that are happening in Haiti by watching videos and reading news articles.
interesting: The money from our fundraising goes directly to Haitians to help children in Haiti achieve a better access to education and technology. Additionally, each year we hope to make a trip down to Haiti so that we are able to see what our fundraising money is going to and experience the amazing Haitian culture.

name: LAHS Esports
keywords: Sports, Teamwork, Competition, STEM, Leisure
description: LAHS Esports is a welcoming gaming community for everyone interested in Esports. All skill levels are welcome and there are plenty of people to play with and against.
activities: Club members have the opportunity to join teams based on their preference of game. Each team can set up playing against each other or other school. Additionally, there will be some competitions with various prizes.
interesting: LAHS Esports is a welcoming gaming community for everyone interested in esports. All skill levels are welcome and there are plenty of people to play with and against.

name: Amnesty International
keywords: Awareness, Community, Outreach, Helping Others, Education
description: To advocate for human rights and raise awareness about social injustices, both locally and abroad.
activities: 1. Develop fundraisers and drive-based community service projects for human rights charities, 2. Collaborate on art installations in peaceful protest, 3. Discuss human-rights to raise awareness and broaden social context
interesting: Please see the videos above.

name: Kpop and Anime Club
keywords: Leisure, Community, Art, Music, Creative
description: To create a place where students can come together, go on adventures and share their interests in kpop and anime
activities: During lunch on Fridays we hangout and talk about kpop and/or anime on a zoom call. We also play games, have tournaments, watch movies, dance and listen to music together. After quarantine we plan to go to event togethers and do other fun actives together like go to concerts, anime conventions, go rafting, make cupcakes, go to japan town, a trip to the beach, going on a speed boat, going to an escape room, paint ball, lazertag, going zip lining, indoor skydiving and so much more.
interesting: Everyone in our club is very nice and everyone has similar interests so theres lots of stuff to talk about but its a diverse group of people. Our activities are always very interesting and random so you'll never be bored.

name: Actively Aware
keywords: Awareness, Outreach, Leadership, Community, Helping Others
description: Actively Aware is a local awareness club that works to inform our surrounding neighborhoods of current issues that would benefit from their help. Our efforts would go into having easily accessible information for resources of current issues including articles, links available for donations, and overall working to educate those around us on matters that need the attention through our online platforms and door to door distributions.
activities:
- brainstorming: current topics worthy of publication and updates, ways to display information, how to fundraise, etc.
- researching all aspects of decided topics
- putting together / organizing info on our door tags
- potentially writing articles
interesting: Knowledge is power! Actively Aware will provide our community members with direct information on how to help those in need and the larger our club is the more people our help can get to. Our club is an outlet for students to become more involved in their community and work towards building awareness.

name: Team HBV
keywords: Awareness, Community, Leadership, Diversity, Outreach
description: To educate and spread awareness about Hepatitis B and discuss the disproportionate cases of Hepatitis B among AAPI communities.
activities:
Learning about Hepatitis B and how it affects the AAPI community.
Brainstorming and discussing ways to spread awareness of the Hepatitis B.
Preparing presentations when we do public speaking at local organizations in order to spread awareness.
interesting: The club is great for students interested in the sciences or pre-med. Participants will learn about diseases and have opportunities to develop and practice public speaking skills.

name: MVLA Speech and Debate
keywords: Public Speaking, Leadership, Competition, Creative, Education
description: Speech and Debate promotes public speaking, writing, and critical thinking skills through practices and local and national tournaments. Join one of the best speech and debate programs in the nation to gain global political awareness while having fun!
activities: During weekly practices, club members improve writing, research, and speech skills and learn the basics of debate and argumentation through fun practice rounds and collaboration with peers.
interesting:
Education: Learn about anything from climate change to AI to police reform. Use your new skills to be a more confident activist for change!
Community: We are a tight-knit, yet welcoming community that is open to all grades and all experience levels. Make lifelong friends by joining our team!
Leadership: Participate in team leadership and service opportunities that provide essential life skills while adding extra flavor to your college app.

name: Girl Up
keywords: Diversity, Awareness, Helping Others, Leadership, Community
description: Girl Up's purpose is to educate and advocate for girls in third world countries as well as advocating for gender equality in our own community.
activities:
- Advocating for women’s rights (petitions, creating infographics, etc.)
- Fundraising to support programs that give girls in developing countries
- Partnering with schools to encourage female youth to explore different career paths, especially in STEM
interesting:
- Leadership and volunteer opportunities
- Creating a world where everyone has equal footing
- An opportunity to use your voice to support something you care about
- Creating a community with like
- Boosting confidence for all individuals

name: LAHS Math Proofs
keywords: STEM, Education, Competition, Creative, Community
description: LAHS Math Proofs club provides a deeper understanding of mathematical proofs and the applications of various mathematical topics found in daily life by giving members an opportunity to expand on their knowledge and improve their problem-solving skills in an open discussion setting.
activities: Club members will actively participate in the various proofs, logic puzzles, and analysis of the applications of mathematical topics found in games, architecture, etc. that will be presented by the co-presidents. Suggestions will also be taken for mathematical ideas to study and members may present a mathematical topic of their choice to the rest of the club (must be approved by co-presidents).
interesting: Our club moves past the formulaic and calculation-based nature of most school math problems and looks deeper into ideas and proofs that require discussion and thinking. We allow members use their knowledge and problem-solving skills to advance their mathematical reasoning.

name: Philosophy Club
keywords: Cultural, Education, Community, Awareness, Creative
description: This club works on developing critical thinking and reflection, as well as interpersonal communication. This can be engaged through discussions, readings, and outside opportunities offered through the club.
activities: Most of the class would be filled with discussions, and we might do some outside readings as well. We have some ideas for collaborative projects that extend philosophy's reach to other humanities. The way you'll think in philosophy club can be applied to everything in your life!
interesting: This club allows individuals to freely express ideas without judgment, and explore alternate theories of thinking. It's a place where intellectuals can discuss current or ancient topics, and instill and develop a philosophical and analytical way of thinking that can be carried throughout life.

name: LAHS Volunteer Society
keywords: Helping Others, Community, Education, Outreach, Awareness
description: LAHS Volunteer Society aims to create a community centered around volunteering and create volunteering opportunities to high school students.
activities: During club events, members will be volunteering in various facilities such as food shelters to assist them in the running of that facility. The focus of club events is the volunteering aspect, but it also includes meeting new people and learning about our community.
interesting: LAHS Volunteering Society creates a community around volunteering and allows members to pick when they want to volunteer. The club is a great way to help to make friends who have a similar passion of volunteering.

name: Competitive Programming Club
keywords: Coding, STEM, Competition, Community, Education
description: To teach college-level algorithmic thinking and prepare individuals and teams for online and local competitive programming competitions.
activities:
- Listen to lectures on competitive programming
- Code!
- Ask for help on anything coding related
- Compete in competitions
interesting:
- USACO are a great way to demonstrate programming skill
- Competing with friends is fun!
- Interview problems of big tech companies (Google, Facebook, Apple, Amazon) are medium difficulty competitive programming problems. Club members can easily pass these technical interviews.

name: Bike Club
keywords: Sports, Creative, Community, Teamwork, Leisure
description: The function of this club is to get people to be motivated to ride their bikes and use bikes as a means of transportation to school and other places. We will teach others how to fix and maintain a bicycle,  bring awareness to the sport of cycling, and show people how much fun riding a bike is.
activities: Talking about bikes, more specifically answering questions about biking in general, teaching members how to perform bike fixes, showing cool routes that people can ride and enjoy.
interesting: Biking is a fun sport and a very good form of exercising. During COVID-19, this can be a form of exercise and a great way to get out of the house. The cycling community is extremely friendly and welcomes everyone regardless of the level of cycling. If you ever wanted to know how to fix your own bike, we have officers who are experienced bike mechanics that can help

name: InPrint
keywords: Creative, Public Speaking, Community, Art, Leisure
description: InPrint is a club dedicated to reviewing books that aren't as well known, especially advanced copies.
activities:
Reviewing books and creating media around them
Helping us brainstorm ways to fundraise
interesting: It's a really fun community and helps open you up to new genres, along with finding kindred spirits who also enjoy your genre of reading.

name: Model United Nations
keywords: Public Speaking, Teamwork, Competition, Leadership, Education
description: To provide interested students with the ability to participate in Model UN conferences, both locally and nationally, which serve the purpose of simulating the real-life UN. Students will learn about and understand complex international issues, enhance oratory abilities, and collaborate to enact change.
activities: In meetings, we will prepare for conferences that occur on weekends and practice MUN skills. Members will have the opportunity to also sign up for conferences and participate in MUN with students from other school.
interesting: Members will be able to attend conferences locally and nationally where they develop critical thinking and diplomacy skills. They'll meet people from all over the world at conferences and work together to create solutions to the issues of today.

name: LAHS UNICEF
keywords: Teamwork, Helping Others, Community, Creative, Awareness
description: Our goal is to make the world (and the Bay Area) a better place by creating a community where LAHS students can kickstart projects and fundraisers for causes they care about.
activities: Our meetings are tailored to each small team and the project they want to carry out. More details on our Club Day Zoom! If physical school returns this year, we are also known for our donut parties!
interesting: Anyone who's always wanted to solve a pressing problem will find a home here. We want to build a community based on doing and creating new things in a supportive environment.

name: Los Altos Computer Science Club
keywords: Coding, STEM, Education, Teamwork, Design
description: The function of this club is to help those who want to improve their Java skills; this will be especially helpful to those taking Intro to Computer Science and AP Computer Science! We cover everything that people learn in APCS, but we explain the material in more detail so that people can understand it better and do better on the AP test.
activities: Learning programming with Java, getting help on APCS homework, and having a place to ask their questions to prior APCS students!
interesting: You should join this club if A) you're currently taking APCS and/or B) you're interested in computer science! There's skills needed to join, and we'll provide you with all the knowledge to gain some basic coding skills. On top of these programming skills, you will gain analytic, organizational, and patience skills - certainly a worthy investment! These skills will help you through your academics as well as life in general. We will also help you if you have any questions as a CS student and provide you with content to guide you through APCS and Intro to CS.

name: LAHS Surfing Club
keywords: Sports, Creative, Leisure, Community, Competition
description: Our goal is to create a welcoming community for anyone that is interested in learning how to surf.
activities: During meetings we will plan future surf trips, share our favorite pre-surfing jams, watch surf clips, and get stoked on surfing. The trips will take place on weekends, so we can have plenty of time in the water.
interesting: This club is a perfect fit for anyone that is interested in learning to surf, and wants an epic group of friends to go with. Or, for anyone that just loves the water and wants to get out and explore something new.

name: Chinese Culture Club
keywords: Cultural, Diversity, Outreach, Helping Others, Community
description: To promote interest in and enrich the community with Chinese language and culture.
activities:
1. Learning traditional Chinese arts and crafts (calligraphy, shan shui painting, paper cutting, paper folding) and dance, music, and musical instruments.
2. Contributing to community festivals (Chinese New Year, Lantern Festival, Mid-Autumn Festival) and community language-learning (tutoring Chinese, consulting on courses, translating).
3. Cooking authentic regional cuisine (dumplings, noodles).
4. Appreciating authentic Chinese material (navigating folk stories about mythical monsters, museums and their artifacts, maps, films, guest speakers who are masters in their fields)
5. Playing traditional Chinese games digitally (Chinese War Chess, Mahjong, “Fight the Landlord”).
interesting:
1. If you are interested in learning Chinese culture (but do not need to understand the Chinese-language): we will hold English sessions to introduce you to Chinese culture through activities such as the Moon Festival celebration, lantern-making, cooking dumplings, and watching Chinese films with English subtitles.
2. If you are interested in learning the Chinese language but do not have prior experience: we will offer you advice to get started learning Chinese based on our own experience.
3. If you are a current Chinese-language student seeking Chinese immersion outside the classroom: we will hold tutoring sessions where you may receive help on your Chinese classwork/homework and further your language skills engaging in conversations with native/fluent Chinese speakers.
3. If you are a fluent Chinese speaker interested in promoting the Chinese language and culture: we will offer you the platform to share your expertise with aspiring students.

name: Dungeons and Dragons Club
keywords: Leisure, Sports, Creative, Teamwork, Community
description: We want to create a space where people can learn and play D&D with their friends as well as meet new people who also love the game! <3
activities: Hang out and play Dungeons and Dragons with friends :)
interesting: Dungeons and Dragons is a really entertaining game to play, especially if you like fantasy RPGs and the likes. We're a pretty casual club and we have an eccentric and friendly community that loves to have fun and hang out

name: girls.
keywords: Helping Others, Awareness, Outreach, Community, Teamwork
description: We help girls in Africa who are in need of sanitary products by donating through the IFRC.
activities: We would be thinking of ways to fundraise and donate to the IFRC.  Furthermore, we'd look into possibly finding ways to individually donate the products.
interesting: This club helps empower women and gives them a chance to volunteer through helping other girls.

name: RAINN
keywords: Diversity, Awareness, Community, Outreach, Helping Others
description: RAINN aims to raise awareness for sexual harassment and assault in our immediate community. It is a safe place for survivors to come forward to get more resources and help.
activities: Club members will help plan events such as - bracelet awareness, piñata smashing etc. As well as discuss current world issues regarding sexual assault awareness and feminism.
interesting: This club will push one to talk about the taboo behind sexual assault and will also push one’s creative boundaries while planning events. Additionally, it will impart knowledge about sexual assault and abuse from all over the world and make one a better rounded global citizen.

name: Viva Venezuela
keywords: Awareness, Cultural, Community, Leisure, Outreach
description: Viva Venezuela seeks to make our community more aware of the hardships faced by the Venezuelan people. In addition, we aim to collect and send much-needed medical supplies to Venezuela.
activities: Club members will learn about the Venezuelan culture and become more aware of the country's current socioeconomic crisis. Club meetings might be spent eating Venezuelan food or even planning fundraisers to aid Venezuelan hospitals. We are hoping to build a community of people inspired to make change while having a good time.
interesting: Very few people are aware of this third world country's crisis and those who join will help change that and provide aid to those in dire need of help!

name: Card Club
keywords: Leisure, Sports, Creative, Teamwork, Community
description: We'll play card games over online platforms and hang out on Zoom calls.
activities: Probably just mess around and have fun together.
interesting: Since we're doing distance learning, we don't get to hang out and eat lunch with each other anymore — this is just kind of a fun excuse for us to spend time together.

name: Peace in the Middle East Club
keywords: Awareness, Outreach, Community, Food, Cultural
description: To create a safe space for students to learn and advocate for issues pertaining to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and other Middle Eastern issues in hopes of bridging peace between various ethnicities in our community.
activities: Club members will participate in discussions and advocacy surrounding these topics. They can also take part in our fundraisers and other school-wide activities.
interesting: Middle Eastern issues are rarely addressed at Los Altos High School and in the Bay Area. Our club is unique in that we bring in guest speakers, have cultural events and engage in discussions around these important issues.

name: Desks for Students
keywords: Helping Others, Outreach, Teamwork, Community, Education
description: We aim to build desks for students in need in our community through fundraising, build-a-thons, desk drives
activities: planning fundraisers, outreach, building desks at their homes
interesting: super hands on, you can see what you've fundraised for, help the community

name: Video Game Modifications Club
keywords: Coding, STEM, Creative, Teamwork, Leisure
description: In this club, we will be predominantly working with Java to make modifications to different video games. The club is open to anyone so coding experience does not matter.
activities: During their time, club members should be brainstorming and coding modifications for video games. By the end of the year, they should have at least one functioning modification for a video game.
interesting: People should join this club if they want to advance their passion in video games to fit their personal preferences and to be able to collaborate with others.

name: End Parkinson's LAHS
keywords: Helping Others, Awareness, Outreach, Education, Community
description:
End Parkinson's LAHS aims to fundraise towards research for a cure to Parkinson's disease as well as educate others about the disease.
We facilitate a direct volunteer partnership with our local chapter of the Parkinson's Foundation.
activities: Members volunteer through the club for the Parkinson's Foundation, and much of our time will be spent in grassroots fundraising as well as advocacy and education events.
interesting:
This is a wonderful opportunity to contribute to an important and often overlooked cause. We also have many leadership opportunities and a tight-knit, welcoming community within our club!
We would love to welcome more volunteers to our club!

name: PBO (Pro-Bono Organizations)
keywords: Helping Others, Community, Teamwork, Outreach, Creative
description: Helping our society by fundraising money for organizations that offer pro-bono legal aid and raising awareness for causes in need
activities:
- Team building and educational activities
- Fundraising for organizations
- Help inform the school/public of the cause
interesting: Because it is an opportunity to help our community and meet expand knowledge on a variety of issues while developing new friendships.

name: LAHS Real Talk
keywords: Public Speaking, Community, Awareness, Education, Cultural
description: Real Talk seeks to empower youth with the skills and language necessary to engage in political discussion with empathy, curiosity, and respect. Our proprietary curriculum works to strengthen members’ critical thinking, news literacy, and civil discourse skills.
activities: Members will engage in current event analysis, roundtable discussions, and team debates. They will also have the opportunity to attend workshops and webinars with various politicians, journalists, academics, and educators.
interesting: Students should join if they want to engage in open political dialogue with their peers as well as learn about current events, how to analyze news, and how to participate in effective civil discourse.

name: Chemistry Olympiad
keywords: STEM, Competition, Education, Teamwork, Community
description: Chemistry Olympiad is an opportunity for students to further their chemistry knowledge beyond the classroom. The club aims to expand membership base by attracting students who may otherwise not have the opportunity.
activities: Club members will engage in chemistry concepts throughout the year by participating in lessons and activities to prepare for the Chemistry Olympiad competition.
interesting: Students will able to enrich their chemistry learning experience by engaging in an outside environment to expand their knowledge in other forms (apart from the classroom environment). Not only is it an opportunity for science enthusiasts to have fun with the subject, but it is a great opportunity for students with interests in other areas to get experience with competitions and team-based learning (students learning from students).

name: Science Olympiad
keywords: STEM, Teamwork, Competition, Education, Leisure
description: Science Olympiad aims to bring together students interested in STEM to prepare and compete in a regional Science Olympiad competition.
activities: During meetings, club members will connect with like-minded students who share a passion for STEM. They will be given the opportunity to learn about topics of their choice and compete with other students in the county.
interesting: With a wide range of events, students are able to discover their interests by exploring different science fields while building a sense of community within the team. Students receive the unique experience of participating in an established science competition with their peers.

name: Indian Students Association
keywords: Culutral, Diversity, Community, Awareness, Leisure
description: The purpose of this organization is to foster a spirit of cooperation among students of Indian origin, to promote understanding and appreciation of Indian culture and philosophy among the campus community by organizing events, and to enable Los Altos students and the citizens of the Los Altos community to gain an appreciation for cultural diversity.
activities: Club members would be helping organize events and be participating in service projects taking place throughout the year.
interesting: This club is new and is a great place for new projects to take place. The club will also spread ideas of Indian culture and philosophy throughout the community. It is also very laid back and fun group to be part of.

name: MediReach
keywords: Outreach, Community, Awareness, Helping Others, STEM
description: MediReach serves to provide medical support to underprivileged and underserved individuals in our community who lack the resources to receive proper care.
activities:
- Creating medical care packages for local homeless shelters
- Fundraisers to provide financial support for patients
- Guest talks with medical professionals to hone in on the field you're interested in
- Cards for young hospital patients all over the country
- Educating kids at local elementary and middle schools on healthy lifestyle habits
interesting: Our club is cool because it combines medicine with community outreach so you're learning about the medical field while also helping those in need.

name: Journal Club
keywords: Creative, STEM, Community, Public Speaking, Education
description: Journal Club serves as a vehicle for introducing cutting-edge scientific literatures to the LAHS student body. Students interested in science and research analyze and summarize science papers in writing introductory articles; recent article topics include medication and diagnostic test for COVID.
activities: Members meet on a regular basis to critically evaluate recently published scientific literatures. Meetings are hosted based on topics selected throughout the school year; one is encouraged to not only discuss but also write journalism on the articles interpreted as a group. Sometimes we analyze data and graphs. Check out our past publications and sign up!
interesting: Reading science papers along could be frustrating, but collaborating with a group of peers and summarize articles for each other provides you a different approach. Students with all backgrounds are welcomed to join; if you might be interested or are interested in science, this is the place for you. There's no set ways in how one chooses to participate in -- reading our articles, join paper discussions, or write and present scientific topics you are fascinated by -- whatever you find fit.

name: Girls Who Code Club
keywords: STEM, Coding, Diversity, Education, Community
description: Girls Who Code Club seeks to close the gender gap in technology and provide a safe space for girls and nonbinary students to be educated, inspired, and equipped with computing skills that can help them in future endeavors. Members will complete multiple projects that span various coding languages, learn communication and teamwork skills, and be able to participate in  opportunities that can be included on their resumes.
activities: Club meetings will include time for members to complete multiple projects that span various coding languages, be inspired by women who have contributed to the tech community, and learn industry skills.
interesting: Girls Who Code Club is a super fun, chill, and inclusive learning environment! You get to decide what projects you want to focus on and you may complete them at whatever pace you need. Absolutely no experience is necessary and any computer, including a school Chromebook, can be used.

name: Make A Birthday Wish
keywords: Helping Others, Outreach, Awareness, Leisure, Community
description: Make A Birthday Wish plans and executes community birthday parties for low income children of all ages in the East Palo Alto area. For this year, our club will readjust to continue helping our targeted community in a safe manner.
activities: Club members will be learning about the needs of their community, helping brainstorm and plan ways to help the low income families, and, depending on the current situation, organize and participate in community birthday parties!
interesting: Our club allows members to learn more about their community, help children in their community receive more opportunities, and interact with them. It is a good way for people to help others locally while having fun organizing and throwing birthday parties!

name: Adventure Club
keywords: Sports, Community, Teamwork, Leisure, Creative
description: To encourage students to have fun outdoors.
activities: Possibly going on hikes (that's what we did last year), but this year we'll have to think of new activities.
interesting: This club is great if you want to meet new people and possibly go outside to do some socially-distanced, mask-wearing activities.

name: LAHS De-Stress
keywords: Community, Leisure, Art, Music, Helping Others
description: The purpose of the club is to help teens de-stress from school and/or work. In this club there will be a variety of activities such as meditation, yoga, making friendship bracelets, journals, de-stress lectures, etc.
activities: Meditation, yoga, jounal-making, chalk art, drawing/doodling/coloring, making friendship bracelets, board games/camp games (maybe not because it's not in person), de-stress lectures, just talking
interesting: It's a fun way to spread positivity and isn't high maintenance either (you wouldn't have to do any work outside the meetings unless you're a club officer). It's also a nice break from school assignments and other things in students lives.

name: Psychology Club
keywords: Education, Community, Awareness, STEM, Creative
description: The psychology club aims to explore a variety of mental health topics and cognitive sciences. In addition, our club will seek to learn about different career paths that can be pursued through psychology.
activities:
Explore different career directions psychology can take
Personality test
Guest speakers
Field trips/social events
Recreate famous experiments that people like Charles Darwin has done
Service animals
Therapy techniques
Dream analysis
Hypnosis
Overcoming phobias
Iq testing
interesting: The psychology club allows members to get more in touch with themselves and learn skills that could be of service to people around them.

name: Teen Tutors
keywords: Education, Community, Helping Others, STEM, Creative
description: Teen Tutors is a club that provides homework help to the local elementary and middle school students as well as reading comprehension workshops for children in partnership with the Los Altos Public Library.
activities: - Members will be tutoring these students and assisting children with their reading virtually, through Zoom
interesting: - This club is an incredible opportunity to help our your community with everything that we are going through! Children are bored at home and need help with their schoolwork, and you can be the one to help them out!

name: Field Hockey
keywords: Sports, Competition, Teamwork, Community, Leisure
description: Our field hockey team (club) strives to compete and honor the game in SCVAL athletics for LAHS, and to enrich athlete's lives with a combination of conditioning, skills training, competition and team activities.
activities: Normally a fall sport. Varsity practices 6 days a week, JV practices 5 days a week. Both teams have games twice a week. We are a fall sport. We also run voluntary workouts and practice in spring and summer.
interesting: Field hockey is a wonderful, competitive sport. Our athletes learn fitness, toughness and play with a strong competitive spirit. All of the girls on both teams form friendships that last throughout their high school years.

name: Stand Up to Cancer
keywords: Health/Disabilities, Helping Others, Awareness, Teamwork, Outreach
description: The function of the club is to raise awareness and support cancer research through fundraisers, while also connecting directly with cancer patients.
activities: During club meetings, we plan future fundraisers and discuss ideas to better raise awareness on campus and in the community. Our activities focus on brightening cancer patients' days and include sending words of encouragement, creating paintings, and other projects.
interesting: Not only do we support cancer research, but we also try to help people going through cancer on a personal level. If you are interested in making meaningful change in our local community and in the lives of those affected by cancer, please join!

name: F.I.R.E.S. - Fire prevention Impact Respond Emergency preparedness Spread awareness
keywords: Outreach, Awareness, Helping Others, Education, Community
description: In the F.I.R.E.S. club, we aspire to educate and spread awareness about the California fires in addition to doing our part to help both ourselves and others prepare for, prevent, and respond to fires.
activities: During our meetings, club members would be learning and spreading awareness about the California fires. Club members will also be looking at ways that they, as high school students, can help prevent, prepare for, and respond to fires.
interesting: Our club aims to make an impact on a major problem we are facing in California: wildfires. By joining this club, students can learn about and give back to the community by contributing to lessening the damage caused by fires.

name: Key Club
keywords: Helping Others, Community, Leadership, Teamwork, Outreach
description: Key Club is a service and leadership organization, with an emphasis on building community with others.
activities:
Service projects during club meetings

Volunteer events and district and international Key Club events outside of school!
interesting:
Meet lots of new people from California, Nevada, and Hawaii

Be able to serve the community with your friends!

name: LAHS Hack Club
keywords: Coding, STEM, Education, Teamwork, Design
description: Our club aims to encourage, inspire, and teach computer science and programming to LAHS students. No experience is required and we teach a range of subjects from web development to machine learning.
activities:
Members can choose from one of four tracks: Web development, mobile development, game development, or python. Beginners with little to no programming experience are encouraged to take the python or web development tracks, and can later in the year if they choose to progress to other courses.
They can also help build websites for school clubs using their news skill and build a portfolio.
interesting: Whether programming has been something you’ve been doing for years, or you’ve just been curious about it, or don’t even know what it is, hack club gives you the opportunity to learn a new skill that is going to be heavily valued in the near future. Students can create a portfolio and gain access to many paid resources, including personal domains.

name: Student Athlete Leadership Team
keywords: Sports, Leadership, Community, Teamwork, Outreach
description: A place for Student-Athletes to develop leadership skills, discuss sports training and plan community-building projects.
activities: Club members will participate in sports training discussions, leadership building exercises, plan community events, and have workouts together.
interesting: Students should join to connect with fellow Los Altos athletes and take an active role in community leadership.

name: Finance & Entrepreneurship Club
keywords: STEM, Leisure, Competition, Teamwork, Creative
description: The Finance & Entrepreneurship club helps students who want to learn more about the field of business and entrepreneurship experience things most start-ups go through and create a pitch to present their idea to others. We also encourage them to participate in the virtual entrepreneurship competitions.
activities: They will be coming up with their own creative idea and will record a pitch presentation broadcasting their idea and the logistics behind it.
interesting: We offer many competitions club members can attend. The majority of them include cash prices that anyone could win. All competitions are virtual.

name: Jumpstart Mentor Club
keywords: Helping Others, Outreach, Teamwork, Community, Education
description: We will be conducting meetings for the Jumpstart Mentor program and will brainstorm ideas along with discussing events.
activities: Brainstorming future events/activities and discussing previous events/activities.
interesting: The jumpstart mentor program is a great opportunity to give back to the LAHS community and helps develop interpersonal skills.

name: Be Okay club
keywords: Health/Disabilities, Outreach, Awareness, Community, Leisure
description: The club is based on the idea that it is okay not be at your best 100% of the time and that it is important to enjoy and notice the small things everyday. We also want to normalize taking care of one's mental health as well as advocate for a variety of mental health issues.
activities: Coming up with fun event ideas. Voicing their thoughts on how to publicize mental health issues. Coming up with mental health topics to address. Coming up with ways to deal with stress and pressure.
interesting: The club takes a fun new twist on how to deal with mental health. The main goal of the club is to create a fun environment where people can destress and have something to get them through the rest of the day. You also get to learn about a variety of mental health issues and how to deal with them!

name: TEDxLAHS
keywords: Public Speaking, Creative, Art, Community, Education
description: The TEDxLAHS club plans for the TEDx event at LAHS, a day in the spring when students and adults have the opportunity to give TED talks for our school. Members of this club help plan the event and find speakers!
activities: Club members would help brainstorm what TEDx will look like this year, since we may not be able to have an in person event (we may host a webinar instead). Club members can also reach out to people who they feel would deliver a great TED talk for event day (students or adults).
interesting: People should join our club because it will further their leadership skills and give them an exciting event to plan for. We are always open to new ideas from club members, and it is very rewarding watching the event occur after much work, dedication, and creativity was put into it by the club members.

name: Red Cross Club
keywords: Health/Disabilities, Outreach, Awareness, Community, Education
description: The Red Cross Club works as a subset of the American Red Cross, supporting their mission of humanitarian aid, and serves the community through service, education, and leadership.
activities:
- Blood drives
- Fundraisers
- Disaster Preparedness
- CPR Certification
- Service Projects
- Disaster Relief
- Emergency Preparedness
interesting:
- College and career skills
- Resume-building experience
- Networking opportunities with community leaders
- Service learning experiences
- Community service hours required for graduation
- Public speaking skills
- Leadership skills
- Volunteer experience and much more!

name: March For Our Lives
keywords: Helping Others, Public Speaking, Community, Education, Awareness
description: We want to bring awareness and make a difference to gun violence laws (or lack of laws) in our community. In this club we will spread awareness, attend city council meetings and marches, and raise money for this cause.
activities: We would be planning city council meetings to attend, fundraisers, and marches to attend. We would also be educating ourselves and our school, on how we can make a difference.
interesting: Someone should join because we have the ability to make a difference in our community and save lives, which is a pretty awesome opportunity given to us.

name: Connect Club
keywords: Cultural, Education, Community, Leisure, Art
description: To teach students common words and phrases of different languages every month, and to learn about different cultures.
activities: Club members will play games, watch funny videos, and eat food (if we ever go back in person). Most importantly, you'll have fun!
interesting: While we are "learning," it is a fun environment, and you can choose to participate as much as you want. We play fun games, at it's very low committment.

name: Girltelligence
keywords: Helping Others, Diversity, Outreach, Health/Disabilities, Leadership
description: A club dedicated to empower girls and women. We will meet to discuss and take action on issues affecting girls and women as well as help girls using the Girltelligence app (all genders welcome)!
activities: We will work on service projects to raise awareness on issues chosen by the club members. We will have discussions and talks from guest speakers as well.
interesting: Feel free to bring in discussion topics and issues you are passionate about! You can email ahead to stay anonymous but it's totally a safe space. We will have guest speakers such as app creator and Stanford psychiatrist Naama Barnea-Goraly.

name: French Club
keywords: Cultural, Helping Others, Community, Art, Teamwork
description: French Club was created in hopes of sharing our appreciation of Francophone culture and the French language, in addition to raising funds for Doctors Without Borders.
activities: Learning about Francophone culture with fun and engaging activities, Helping us plan and run fundraisers and other events, Meeting new friends with similar interests, Learning fun new words in French, Helping us expand our membership and come up with ideas as a group!  **It is not required for students be enrolled in a French language class, ALL are welcome!
interesting: We are looking for new members, regardless of their knowledge of French or Francophone culture! We always have lots of good food, and throw multiple parties a year. We are also known across campus for our famous Nutella crêpe fundraisers!

name: Junior State of America
keywords: Public Speaking, Teamwork, Education, Leisure, Creative
description: JSA serves to highlight important political events and news in an open forum for debate, discussion, and thought. We welcome opinion across the political spectrum—everyone's thoughts mean something, and should be treated as such.
activities: Taking the role of national leaders in World Politics Simulations, discussing modern policy and politics, work out law in Congressional Simulations, have meaningful debate.
interesting: JSA is the largest student-run organization in the US. Our environment welcomes every political belief, and we seek to learn from what others believe. Not only are we able to seriously discuss heavy subjects, but we also have a bit of fun with simulation activities.

name: Jewish Culture Organization
keywords: Cultural, Food, Public Speaking, Leisure, Community
description: The club serves to increase understanding of Jewish culture, tradition, & current issue. Also to celebrate the unique elements of Israeli lifestyle, culture, and Jewish Tradition.
activities:
-Celebrating Jewish Holidays with good food and games.
-Engaging in the exciting elements of Israeli culture.
interesting:
-Fun activities with friends, and food at every meeting.
-Opportunity for leadership positions and new initiatives surrounding Jewish Culture

name: Latino Student Union
keywords: Community, Art, Music, Cultural, Leadership
description: To spread appreciation for Latino culture, and awareness for problems facing the Latino world.
activities: -Learning about culture from different Latino countries -Help planning events like Dia de Los Muertos, Homecoming decorating and parade ect. -Community building through activities
interesting: LSU is a community centered in Latino culture. LSU gives it's members the oppurtunity to appreciate their latino culture, or learn more about it.

name: Idea Central
keywords: Leadership, Creative, Education, Community, Leisure
description: To encourage everyone to pursue their own passion projects by learning the principles of business, marketing and design. Passion projects can be anything that makes an impact on the community.
activities:
- participating in business-related discussions and activities
- working on projects connected to your passion (ex: politics, fashion, food, video games, art, pretty much anything you're interested in)
- communicating with other club members on their projects
- having fun!
interesting:
- you'll gain valuable experience in business/marketing design
- you'll join a diverse community of people pursuing different topics
- go as far as starting your own nonprofit or small business!

name: Physics Club
keywords: Design, Competition, STEM, Teamwork, Community
description: To inspire students to pursue physics and encourage them to explore and compete in this subject
activities: People would learn physics together, solve and discuss problems, seek help if needed, and connect with others interested in Physics.
interesting: It is an open club for all members and a great opportunity to strengthen math, science, and problem-solving skills. People can work together in an enriching environment and have fun.

name: CENG
keywords: Education, Coding, Helping Others, STEM, Caring
description: We are CENG, Computer Engineers of the Next Generation. We teach local elementary schools SCRATCH programming, targeting schools with lower income demographics.
activities: You will be spending time teaching students, creating new curriculum, and working on projects such as fundraisers.
interesting: If you are interested in programming and want to help teach kids how to love programming too, this is the club for you!

name: Astronomy Club
keywords: STEM, Creative, Leisure, Community, Cultural
description: The Astronomy Club is a creative outlet for people to explore their interest in astronomy through astrophotography.
activities:
- Learn how to operate telescopes, mounts and cameras
- Process and stack images to create a final product
- Collaborate in imaging and processing images of deep-space objects
interesting: You can capture breathtaking images of galaxies, nebulae, and planets from your very own backyard using provided telescopes and equipment! You can also refine your computer skills through learning to use Photoshop and other astrophotography software.

name: Yoga Club
keywords: Leisure, Sports, Cultural, Art, Community
description: Practicing yoga techniques including stretching, balance, and loosening up tight muscles that have been cooped up in front of zoom all day
activities: Participating in a virtual yoga session lead by Ms. Abel
interesting: Yoga is great for wellness and body control—things that are especially important in such a stressful, sitting-behind-a-desk-intensive time.

name: Thought Bubble
keywords: Leisure, Creative, Cultural, Public Speaking, Community
description: Thought Bubble is a club that will provide students with a space to indulge in deep discussions about random things they wonder about, like how closely do we tie our name with our identities? Any and all inquiries are welcome, as long as you're willing to talk about them in a judgement-free discussion.
activities: We would be discussing our thoughts about topics that intrigue us, regardless of how serious or whimsical they are. We'll just sit around and talk, snacks are encouraged.
interesting: Have you ever had a wonky thought, totally out of this world, that you had trouble explaining or felt awkward talking about with your peers? Do you want to discuss the worldly thoughts that pop up when you're taking a shower or laying in bed? Thought Bubble is exactly the place to explore those topics with like-minded people.

name: Hot-s-Pot Club
keywords: Food, Community, Creative, Cultural, Leisure
description: Hot-s-Pot club strives to connect people virtually through experimenting with internet recipes together and helps people find joy in cooking.
activities: During our lunch club meetings, we will be experimenting with different online recipes and exchanging foreign recipes with the rest of the World. We will be cooking or baking together through zoom.
interesting: Everyone can experiment, explore, and learn cooking skills by testing online recipes. People can also become friends with other club members through their bond over cooking.

name: Planned Acts of Kindness
keywords: Helping Others, Community, Creativity, Art, Leisure
description: Our club plans to pursue projects at least every month (possibly more frequently) to engage the school in activities that promote kindness and community building. Something we did last year was creating appreciation PAKs, goody bags filled with personalized notes and candy, for people to surprise their friends and make their day a little better.
activities: Club members would be brainstorming, planning, and participating in our monthly projects, as well as helping to set them up and distribute materials (if necessary). The members will be really instrumental in these events, and it will be very hands-on!
interesting: We hope to bring together the school community. We know it can be hard to expand outside your friend group, but with our projects, we aim to bring people together in unlikely ways. Additionally, we will offer resources and platforms that help de-stigmatize and mental health. We encourage people to make the conscious decision to be kind to themselves and others.

name: Dream Volunteers
keywords: Helping Others, Community, Creativity, Art, Leisure
description: Dream Volunteers aims to empower Los Altos students to serve here in our community and even with students internationally.
activities: Club members will participate in service events and communicate with international students.
interesting: Over the summer, we taught classes to students in Guatemala over Zoom! We are hoping to work more with our international peers and also do some service here in our own community.

name: MEDscience Club
keywords: Helping Others, STEM, Design, Creativity, Teamwork
description:
Do you have a deep interest in medicine or medical research? Have you ever dreamed of being a doctor, nurse, paramedic, or biomedical research scientist, and wondered how to start down that road?
If so, there is a place for you here at Harvard Medical School, and it’s called the MEDscience Club. But it’s more than just a club; it’s a fully virtual academic and medical experience where you work as a team with a small group of likeminded peers.
Our 90-minute classes are held once a week for six weeks with each session focusing on a different body system. Each week your small working team will learn anatomy and physiology background information while tackling a challenging medical case related to a particular system. Actual live Harvard biomedical faculty and staff will play the roles of your patient and medical consults, nurses, and technicians, and lead you through these exciting and challenging experiences.
As a MEDscience student, you will be asked to work as a team, sharing leadership roles, think critically as you problem solve, and make precise diagnoses of ailing patients. To do so, you will interview patients, take their medical histories, request medical tests and imaging, and suggest basic physical exams using stethoscopes, EKGs, pulse oximeters, radiological scans, and other actual medical technologies.
But there’s more! The program will help you seriously consider future healthcare career opportunities by introducing you to a network of Harvard-affiliated healthcare professionals. You will participate in engaging career conversations to learn about their specialties and career paths, as well as some of their most interesting patient cases.
The cost of this program is only $300 for the six-week session and each graduating student receives a Harvard Medical School MEDscience certificate of participation. Don’t miss this amazing opportunity!
activities: Club members will be participating with the Harvard MEDscience staff to create a lively experience where you are able to engage in real-life medical situations.
interesting: Our club is interesting because we are not just going to be learning about medicine, we will be able to put people in live cases where they can participate. Therefore, you aren't just learning about medicine, you are able to put yourself in a position where real life doctors/nurses/etc are put in daily!

name: Business Venture Club
keywords: Teamwork, Creativity, STEM, Leisure, Design Community
description: The business venture club allows students interested in business to seek help and lean about different aspects of the process from their peers as well as to get resources that will help them start a small business. Later in the year there will be opportunities to start a real business and work with other members of the club to have it grow and put their knew-found knowledge to use.
activities: Learn various skills as well as coming up with ideas and working with others on small business projects.
interesting: It gives members the opportunity to start a business that revolves around something their passionate about and potentially make some money doing it as well.

name: Creative Writing Club
keywords: Creative, Leisure, Cultural, Education, Community
description: The Creative Writing Club is a place for anyone who wants to express their creativity through any form of writing! We will be sharing techniques, works, and writers, writing our own works, and in general just having a good time :)
activities: Club members will be writing their own pieces, sharing and reading works written by others or by authors/poets/etc., listening to performances/excerpts, and talking to other members.
interesting: The Creative Writing Club is a great place to have fun writing and talking to other creative people!

name: Junior Classical League
keywords: Cultural, Creative, Art, Leisure, Community
description: We are LAHS's branch of the Junior Classical League (JCL), and we aim to share and facilitate a love of Greco-Roman culture, as well as educate others on the classics.
activities: Watching classics-related movies, play Certamen (trivia game), learning about various topics related to greco-roman culture, things related to NJCL (affiliated national organization)
interesting: If you enjoy the classics, or are interested in learning more about the culture and history of the ancient Greeks and Romans, this club is right for you. We have fun activities, and since the club is associated with the NJCL, there's a large community beyond this school.
